7vgxJkneuXqq2N-SXMRxbA.text: The Refinery has very recently opened so I was very much looking forward to sampling the lunch on a Friday afternoon. It is a spacious bar with a simple metallic type decor and an all day food menu with an emphasis on organic ingredients.I thought it would be nice to organise a work lunch which I have to say, I wasn't too impressed with. After speaking with the staff on a number of occasions prior to the day, I had arranged for a selection of mixed platters and emphasised that everyone would be quite hungry! On arrival, we had an area reserved but no table and the food wasn't nearly filling enough for the party - most people bought chips on the way back!The staff however are very attentive and friendly and I was really disappointed that the lunch wasn't too great. On an evening, I also feel that the bar lacks atmosphere - as a result of aiming to be ultra modern and chic, the Refinery consequently doesn't have an ounce of character or charm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

HXnGXrlSraU6iy4eFiPScA.text: I really like this place... mostly because the one cocktail I had was so great! I had the Cuban spritzer... which is a mojito strained and topped with prosecco... very refreshing and nice but at £8 for a tiny glass it made me sad because I would have taken another 3 of them. I love the innovative cocktails here and I tried a small table bar appetizer and it wasn't bad... I haven't had a full meal there yet. I also like the arty and classy decor along with the clientele. I say if you are in the area why not try it...

qDiDDdIxgNEUlCPg61D4nw.text: Visited The Refinery in early Jan 2011 for a friend's birthday drinks with a group of about 40 people. Had one of the best night's out in a long time, the music was fabulous (we specifically went for the 80s soul night), the crowd was fun-loving with no bad attitudes on display at all. The bar prices were pretty reasonable for a venue in London, in fact, I was stunned at buying at round for about 8 people and thinking I'd expected it to have cost double the amount I paid! Door staff and bar staff were all friendly and mega efficient. We had a reserved seating area but didn't order food as we were out for drinks and dancing, but I wish we'd sampled some of the food as everything else was so good! Toilets were clean and lots of them - I hate it when you go to a large venue and there are too few toilets! The smoking area was one of the coolest I've experienced in my life. There were high tables and stools and a couple of sofas but the best bit was the fact that they'd put out pashminas and scarves for people to keep warm when going out for a cigarette! The most considerate bar/club I've ever been to where smokers are concerned!

3etVJUGQA5-tBqdN_Sz3gQ.text: Good ambience. Packed. Seated quickly and coffee order taken. I like the groove of this place - beaten up but comfortable furniture, cool lighting and such. Coffee takes ages. Arrives finally but waiter darts from the table before taking breakfast order. Manage to coax him back. Latte is lukewarm. Notice now that others sat around me don't have food and are starting to look over at the kitchen with worried expressions on their faces. Food arrives prompty despite this. Looks good. Benedict has spinach, they must be confused. Spinach extracted and the flavours are ok. But again, lukewarm. All is perched on some woefully under-toasted muffins that turn doughy and heavy as time wears on. Need to be hot and crunchy. Hash browns prove to be highlight overall, which is a shame, as they were just a side. I think a plate of those next time. Want another coffee but wait staff doing their best at flying around looking incredibly busy. Don't think I'll bother coming back, plenty of better options in this area. Want to pay the bill. Think I might have to send up a flare...

LnYMPiXrQfmsUXbh-5uSCw.text: I had lunch here, we had no problem getting a table for two. This place is very appealing  it's a large restaurant, nicely decorated and can accommodate everyone from couples to families to large groups. The menu has a lot of choice and variation. Although the food tasted nice, I was slightly disappointed with the service  it wasn't very busy but service was still a bit slow, albeit very friendly. One of our drinks was left behind by the waiter and this took about 15 minutes to catch up, and the time between sitting at the table and taking our order was a bit too long. My only other gripe and you may have read similar comments in other reviews I've posted  I'm not a fan of the fashionably pretentious way of serving chips/fries in strange objects it's most restaurants stick them in little buckets these days but the Refinery put mine in a cup and my wife's in a flower pot. Just stick them on the flippin' plate! Oh and my bill arrived tucked in to an old paperback book overlook all these silly things and you'll enjoy lovely food and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

og_UxXyRLdKsxCBzLRX4AQ.text: A decent enough bar from the same people who brought you the Parlour at Canary Wharf, Folly in the City and a couple of other bars dotted around.Food is excellent and attractively served. Drinks are a bit expensive and perhaps unsurprisingly the place is best avoided in the evening owing to the presence of toffy City-types throwing their money around in typical vulgar fashion!It's nicest at the weekend, and between lunchtime and clocking-off time during the week.

tUnC83KgVAGslzeHT_WT9Q.text: Horrible!First, the service was terrible.Second, when you have a design like this restaurant (contemporary, open to ventilation ducts, etc.) you need to pay attention to things like dust.If they would drop the cuteness and concentrate on what matters, it might be a decent place -- drop the clothes-pinned menu and simplify things; drop the cutting boards and clay pots for food and get proper plates, drop the books used for delivery of checks. Just one gimmick after another, and none of them work and together they REALLY DON"T WORK.

dMJYOVdYuwG23JptwKjZiQ.text: Yep another yummy option for spiffy little Canvey Street. The Refinery is an attractive place with an equally good looking menu. I went here for brunch (londonist.com/2009/08/re…) and really enjoyed it. Proper eggs Benedict! I'm certain to return (soon I hope) because it was a hard choice with lots of other items tempting me. Great coffee too.Aside from the food, I really like the eclectic decor and spacious setting. It felt like a very comfortable place to hang out for awhile over good conversation and a few beers while still retaining a quality dining atmosphere.

xxFcnk0iV6hrlrqsBlKclg.text: The Refinery has become a bit of a regular haunt. I've had lunch there, with friends, several times and the food, on the whole is always very good. I've tried many of their regular dishes and most recently, sampled a gorgeous mushroom-stuffed, mini-pumpkin affair. Nice use of season produce too. Haven't yet moved onto the dessert menu though! Wine list is good but has no NZ options (my fave), that I recall. Service is always friendly and efficient. The decor is warm, the space uncramped and it's very easy to spend time there. Great value for money too.

ZCvN91Ky1H-OepNuYCnyEA.text: Great food, innovative and fresh presentation of all dishes from the drinks to the entrees to the desserts. And even the bill was presented in an old book with a London Oyster pass cover as a gift. :)  The wait staff was a little slow and not exactly friendly and it took a very long time to receive our food (1 dish was sent back because the waitress placed the order wrong in the kitchen), but once received, we really enjoyed our meal and beverages.  You have to check this place out and give it a try.

cPO4Sx2m9KJPhMlDDn1eBQ.text: Basically the only reason that this survives is that it is convenient for the suits who work above it. Without this monopoly the overpriced drinks and amazingly s l o w service would mean that they are out of business. There is no reason for the slow service  there are plenty of staff, plenty of taps however the staff are never in a hurry despite having a packed house or maybe they are just not competent enough.Unlike many people in London I do however like the modern decor that the place has and the staff are friendly enough.

WFAM_TDPoh5VdoEj0CJmeQ.text: It is almost quite impressive.  The Refinery has managed to export the soulness nature of many a city bar all the way south of the river.  Remarkable.

PVd5YY4JKq_gZZyFDV_SsQ.text: So I was back here last night for a few post work pints and it was busy, with a capital BI.  I was put straight on the fact the deck chairs and outside screen are not actually provided by the Refinery but rather Southwark Council.  In my original review they sneaked an extra star because I thought they were responsible for the outside entertainment, since they're not it only seemed fair to do a quick update and knock them back down to a 3.  All other observations stand.  I thank you.

qujiEex1KTkcGZupI82PGA.text: This was one of the first meals I had in London, and probably the 5th review I've written.  After trying a few other places around town, I downgraded my 4 star to a 3 star.  The service was good and the chef looked like he meant business.  I ordered the swordfish special since it sounded awesome.  Unfortunately, the portion size was literally 4 bites (which I stretched into 8 by kinda nibbling on small bites).  The other people with me had bigger portions (the crayfish pasta looked good) and the fish and chips I heard was pretty good.  I'll probably give this place another shot and order something else.

n3_9qDJmEHlDN2UmVHyfFA.text: The Refinery did our xmas lunch and I have to say it was very good. The food quality was miles better than you normally get for a group xmas booking and the service was great.No Christmas music :-( but it was still the end of November (dont ask!). The menu choice was great, turkey, lamb, cod and pumpkin for the veggies. We pre-selected so no fussing over the menu on the day. I had duck pate for my starter, very meaty and served with pears and toasted bread, yummy! Turkey dinner for main, a big thick slice (like 2 inches!!!) of turkey breast with all the trimmings, really good qulaity. And a chocolate torte to finish ot all off...divine. As the host I asked the other diners what they thought of the other dishes and they all loved it. They set up a bar tab for us so we washed it all down with superb beer and prosecco. Couldn't fault it at all, def. a contender for next years outing. We had 25 of us and even though some people turned up very late no fuss was made by the staff they just rushed off and brought them whatever food they wanted. I have also eaten lunch here several times as its opposite my office, and the food has always been great, you'll pay around £15 for lunch including drinks). Have also organised evening drinks here too and the staff are so helpful will tailor the night to whatever you want. Def worth a visit, any time of day

9-ecPRUCX6x-i2N4AEp-5w.text: What a great place for brunch (lunch, dinner, drinks whatever)! Located right behind the Tate Modern, The Refinery is a swish place with dark wood, high ceilings and an all around slick interior that nevertheless feels comfortable. I had a baked three egg omelette with mushrooms, tomatoes and cheddar, served with crusty toasted bread. My dining companion had delicious looking eggs Benedict. Service was friendly and quick. There weren't too many people there on a Saturday afternoon, but that was a nice change of pace. I would certainly return.

S4NVa37zaM7Rc5YB2IZwxA.text: Wooden floors, shiny surfaces and nice big high ceilings. The food at lunch is really great value (£8 for a stacked Salmon burger, chunky chips and salad). Good wine and nice bustling place.

L5lB_B9XMP8c1lNzu2E9uA.text: Tl;dr. Good cocktails, eclectic decor, friendly staff... *terrible* food.--So we ended up here yesterday due to it's proximity to the Tate Modern.On arrival the staff seemed really friendly and accommodating and it was good to get in from the rain. I noticed on the way in that all of the tables on the outside had little fleece blankets which I thought was a really thoughtful touch.The place looks cute on the inside, a big open space cross between the whole 'thrown together' aesthetic and a bit warehouse-y.We both ordered a cocktail - I had the skinny superfood collins and my husband had the blueberry margarita. No complaints there.Looking at the menu, the food is pretty much traditional pub food, but more expensive. We ordered the steak and chips (£15) and I had the market fish and the scampi (£10ish.) Unfortunately this is where they let themselves down. With my scampi and fish although the batter was light, it was still very greasy and left me feeling a bit queasy and the chips were horrible. A bit chewy and just not, well.. very nice tasting, cheap. The steak wasn't tender and had a lot of fat on it, in fact almost a third of it was fat. A noticeable weight in our pocket to take home to the dog... Unfortunately after our unappealing food, my opinion on the place changed a bit. My food was served on a chopping board, in a small imitation fry basket with a muslin cloth tied lemon. The steak also came on a board, with a small old fashioned style milk jug for the sauce and the chips came in a.. plant pot. The ladies next to us, I'm not sure what they had, but one of their starters came in a rather sizeable picnic hamper! I think that unfortunately it's a case of style over substance. If they paid as much attention to the quality of their food as they did in the eccentric and eclectic way they served their food they'd go along way. Their attention to detail seems to bypass the actually quality. Anyway - what's wrong with a plate?We spent £50 and it just was not worth it. There's a  chance I'd go back for cocktails if we were in the area again, but I would never waste my money eating there.

F7E347qrQHe3XyY9rKPNvg.text: I really love the Drake and Morgan bars/restaurants and this is no exception. I think they are the cutest and prettiest bars I've ever been to! With vintage decorations, plants, teapots, candles, cute china, cocktails in mason jars and beautiful props around it's just a really lovely place to go with a lovely atmosphere. It's a little pricey but not excessively so. I've not eaten here but I've heard the food is great. The cocktails are outstanding and they have a decent wine list too. There's a nice area outside to sit in the summer too, just get there early as it does get busy.If you're not around London Bridge/Southwark, check out The Folly near Monument or The Parlour in Canary Wharf. I think they might have another one too  but I'm not sure off the top of my head.

V22MOPjzva3LLEHXtWvabw.text: Great food and service!No problems with service what so ever. I'm glad I didn't take the previous yelp reviews into account as we had a great evening at a location I would certainly come back to. The flatbread starters are delicious and definitely worth the try.

rgAr6bLBJGpQT7V9KKrgqA.text: Seduced by a tomato. Yes, a fruit called by any other name is still a fruit! This tasty, sweet, drenchingly good friend to us all, had its wicked way with me.Unsuspecting me, sitting quieting waiting for my companion to arrive, unbeknown to me, it came in the form of a pressed delight crowned with the King of the ocean.Caesar was his name and my first encounter was delectable, spicy and seasoned within an inch of its life... Ketel one vodka, clamato juice, tabasco,salt, pepper, lemon juice, celery stick & king prawn garnish w/ a celery salt rim I suggested marrying your Mary to an afternoon sit-in with a paper and some brunch, because even though it tastes like juice it has a cheeky kick that could leave you a bit rosy!If you do nothing else this weekend, try this twist on a traditional Bloody Mary, but don't blame me for whatever happens next.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom. Bloody Caesar

SK92Vn8FenV7U5UARns5ag.text: Perfect spot for after work drinks and a bite to eat. The Refinery has a good selection of snacks and do good cocktails too. Good atmosphere for a big group of friends.

BJKKrYHpJ9b2i8Pl6DEceA.text: Great funky place to go and eat. Really good atmosphere. good bar with some good cocktails!Food was nice too.It looks like it gets really busy so I recommend booking. Staff are super friendly. Im going there again for a party of 30 and they have been really helpful by offeriing a pre-order service and/or set menus.

QrP2ix7urHODoWZjPUPq_Q.text: Stopped in with the boys from the office on an insanely packed Friday.  It's no wonder - the sun is out and the Londoners are loving it.  I left LA to escape the sun and it has somehow followed me here. Argh.The venue is almost all glass and steel.  I suppose they're going for the industrial yet homey feel.  It works.  It's spacious, too, ideal for hosting large parties.The lunch menu is enormous.  From what I recall entrees start at GBP 7.00 to upwards of GBP 13.00, depending on whether you're in the mood for some dead cattle on your plate.  Orders are served to you on iron skillets placed atop wooden planks.  Cute.The pork sausage with sweet sauteed onions on mash is definitely a boy's dish - it's hearty, hits the spot and, most importantly, an animal perished for it.  The coworkers sent for a steak sandwich and some sort of Thai noodle delivered in a brown take-away box (again, the restaurant is trying to be cute with their plating).In all a good lunch experience.  Useful tip: reservations are taken for inside seating only.  Outside tables are first-come-first-served only and are not serviced by waiters.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

swgQipSSxuC4wnUffD0_wQ.text: I just had brunch at The Refinery yesterday by chance (were supposed to go elsewhere but the queue was pretty long).  I must say, I'm glad I got to check this place out, as it wasn't on my radar.  The food is delicious and the ambiance is really fun.  I especially love the decor, as it is lively and energetic.  Additionally, although it does take reservations, there were quite a few tables available, which for a Sunday at noon is pretty hard to find.  I would absolutely come back!

oieFOMVfFyXjwTRH8qMqKg.text: Absolutely the worst service I have encountered in years. I'm not exaggerating when I say it took the staff over a half hour to take our very first drink order, and the drinks (some of them incorrect) arrived exactly ONE HOUR after we had first sat down. Things only went downhill from there. Not one person's order was executed correctly. I have a pretty high tolerance for mistakes - no one is perfect. But what I cannot tolerate is attitude. On top of shocking incompetence, our main waitress rolled her eyes at every single request we made. "Could we have more water, please?" elicited an eye roll. "Could I please see the drinks menu again?" got us another eye roll. It never stopped. She was rude, dismissive, and gave the clear message that we were a significant annoyance to her. And my group is full of respectful, low maintenance people who have all previously held wait-staff jobs, so we go out of our way to be polite and easy at restaurants. Of all the fantastic restaurants in London, I'm disgusted that we wasted a rare sunny afternoon at this restaurant. Never again.

J6VsnQXwr92vd7ZLskcdqg.text: So I've been here a few times for different events and have always had a good time. Mainly with work, we're always looking for places to go that are a bit away from our usual drinking spots, so the Refinery (a 5 minute cab ride away) is perfect.I came here last night for a friend's birthday drinks - table/ one of those bar stool sized benches was reserved in perfect stumbling distance to the bar! Good drinks (a bit overpriced) but service was nice and it's never too busy.I've also been here for a Sunday brunch. We were seated at a long table - the staff were really understanding about our constantly changing numbers. But we were put right next to the door which was cold when it kept being left open. I had the full English breakfast (nice touch serving it in a cast iron pan), all very tasty and filled me up. For about £8 that's not too bad either. Also a chemex filter drip which was filled with really nice coffee! My friend (not the scientist like me) had real fun filtering the hot water through - just like high school science! The waitress could NOT figure out how to do this properly, awkward..There were two other issues - a friend ordered crumpets that were stone cold in the middle. NOT GOOD. also we couldn't get hold of the waitress to pay and leave... side not, why is it SO DIFFICULT in restaurants to pay and leave, especially if you're in a hurry!! I don't get it, do they not want our money... hmm.

JiImTa_lJx6HqtDWCl5VxA.text: A nice, comfortable bar to catch up with friends at. I like the decor and there is lots of space in and outside with a range of seating options, all of which are comfy. The staff are very friendly, helpful and always willing to suggest a cocktail.On that note, here are my top two tips to enjoy the Refinery: first, try the cocktails, plus the wines and beers are also good, but I'd avoid the food as it's not always up to scratch. Tip number two is avoid peak times - this place can get very packed, so my favourite time to visit is Saturday after lunch or another off-peak time.

13CoIOJ_kR0yoZg0zW3DHg.text: I went here for dinner one night with a couple of friends as I live right next door. The food was good but the portions were rather small for the prices. However, it does have a cool vibe and gets very crowded, especially on weekend nights.

OBxVsSY2Ar4nRnlGMOV0OA.text: A year or two ago I would have given this place 4 stars but it has lost its sparkle since then.This used to be a great place to go on a sunny evening after work for a game of bowls and a tangy Orangina teapot shot. The servers were friendly, fiesty and always making the rounds.Now it's like the fun has been sucked out of the place. It is still a good place to have a drink with friends but it has a more subdued atmosphere.Bring back the teapot shot and I'll be back in there!

_4J7-oupChVjLYPYk7xJ_g.text: Ok, this place is great for dates--quiet enough for conversation, open and elegant.We went for drinks...but the guys at the bar had no CLUE how to make the drinks on the menu. Pulled out a recipe book....still got it wrong. They didn't know what they put in the drinks they served us. At least the drinks were strong and nobody kicked us out when we were the last customers left there!

M9bJUkmsKaB3VIS8dRLCQA.text: Other than an impressive decor, none of the 3 of us had a good meal nor did we have any semblance of good service.  This was mid-afternoon on a weekday, the place was not busy and they had plenty of servers so there was no excuse for this.  This was the only bad food/service experience we had during a one week stay in London.

Qiu9FCH6cBa0SbTUlxj0ng.text: Food is poor for them money; oyster is bland, lobster is dry, steak is almost unchewable. But chicken satay starter is good, and the cheese box dessert is creative. Service is fine as well

MGGlxDBkIslVVIEArdQfYQ.text: The bar service generally takes forever, so slow and inefficient. Food is a-ok, nothing I would take a date or my family to and say "great food and service", more a place for lunch with workmates and the rain keeps you to stay close to work...

WAMUHerPedgPOqsiXHREXg.text: This was a let down. I found this a shame and surprising being as the decor was appealing and the food wasn't half bad. However, the service was some of the worst I have seen and it really soured my entire impression of The Refinery. Sadly, I will not be returning.

_8wR-IrbTi_Y_HxlFBozRQ.text: This place is great for a Saturday brunch! The fish and chips were delicious. We also had the the duck flatbread. Yum!!

nX3stWDdpE2EajH36r8ESQ.text: Situated on the ground floor of the Blue Fin Building at the corner of Southwark Street and Canvey Street, this new bar is part of the Bankside Mix shopping and dining area. It's bloody lovely to boot with plush, contemporary furnishings (bookable booths), an open kitchen and outdoor seating which was decked out in Wimbledon fauna and foliage for devoted fans to put their feet up and watch the action.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

DvwAV05kIIcJFvUwys1CSQ.text: Had full English breakfast/brunch with great americano coffee and vanilla latte! Very filling and traditional English food! Would definitely recommend! Great service with tip included. Cute location and nice outdoor seating!! Wanted to try some of their fancy liquor drinks but we were too full!! (And on our way to Tower of London) also great location close to everything! Not as pricey as we thought it would be to be honest. Not even 30£ total. It seems to be even fancier at night.

f_fPOlntDjdmeW0zmuFA3Q.text: Visited after a day of sight seeing. The vibe was great there were a lot of people there socializing  near the bar. While the bar area was very crowded the seating area for dinner was pretty spacious. The waiter was friendly and brought out our food and drinks within a timely manner. While there I had a burger  and it was okay but the drinks were amazing!

1Ua1kkPK8gM8DztPITqi-w.text: Visited refinery for a post work drinks with my colleagues. It's quite near where I work and looked more modern and hence different from other joins in around which are more 'traditional' if you could call that.The ambiance is pretty nice, modern and lots of energy but in terms of the fare there is nothing really unique was my view.The standard drinks, the food was not bad and not great too and the staff were friendly. I felt that the space was bit cramped for a large group, which we were. I also felt that the portion sizes were not very generous considering the price (around £20 for a sharing platter, check out the photo)Overall pretty ok experience but if you are looking for someone different from other businesses in and around London Bridge / Southwark then you are better off heading somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

nFwvo8OZoTv-Udw4XkX4bQ.text: Like the other reviewers mentioned, it's solid food in the area. My server was super attentive and made sure to come around to check up on me. I sat outside for a leisurely brunch and people watched while enjoying my coffee, scotch egg, and crispy duck salad. I really like the duck salad, the sweet hoisin sauce with the crispy duck and greens made it refreshing for the hot sunny day. Some drink offerings were almost enticing me to order. Maybe next time I'm staying in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

SaG0YgsD1p-hAfHqChfoXw.text: We came here tonight after the place we initially tried to go to (across the street) was closed even though they advertised they were open. This place was such a joy to be at! The old fashioned that I had was the best I have had in London so far and we just moved here from NYC. Bangers and mashed were on point as were the chicken sand which. Really lovely staff, great atmosphere, reasonable prices! I would 110% recommend this place. So happy the other place falsely advertised so we could find this gem! We will be back very soon as we just moved here and are looking for our new "go to" spot!!

5y9TNLCn2-BkPd3MWPjQpg.text: On a gloomy day in London, The Refinery is simply a solid brunch spot. Not a game changer and not so much a scene that it's going to redefine your weekend breakfast routine, but without a lot of options in this area on a sleepy Sunday, it satisfies.The decor is like a midcentury meets minimalist mish mash. Not everything matches and it lends to an eclectic look. Food wise I went with the bangers and mash. It was a little pricier than the more pedestrian versions of this famous British dish, but it was also elevated enough to justify the jump in cost. Added a Bloody Mary and it was just the thing to start the day.If you're staying somewhere in the 'hood (Citizen M hotel, for instance), you'll find plenty to warrant a quick bite.

wnqVQYHWM5Ak0EMlIxoMGQ.text: Asparagus  was good despite being really heavy on the oil. My son's burger was decent. Fries were a bit nasty. Top fries were edible, but those at the bottom were dripping in oil.

tCHyuXMeV26q1Z38IN_Hgw.text: In the area for business, and The Refinery was a good reliable place I had no problem visiting twice in a week.  The wine was good, the food quality was good, the service was good, and the food presentation was very nice.  I'm a fan.

33G0nOxFl9zWOPOKbzHrvQ.text: The refinery is a good local watering hole in Southwark so we recently decided to try it as a lunch spot too. The service was attentive and they have plenty of menu options to choose from. Personally I would choose this again as a group lunch option as the quick service and delivery of food mean it would be perfect for large work lunches.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

hZJ-KP02tgOodu1YHydphA.text: I was at The Refinery last night for a couple of work drinks. I had heard a bit about it before hand from other friends who loved the place but it wasn't anything too special.The beers on tap are quite varied and allow a lot of choice and the work and presentation the bar men and women put into mixing a short or cocktail is quite amazing. Be prepared to pay a pretty price though.That all being said there were some downsides. The place itself is very dimly lit and the music is pumping out to the point where you think you should be in a club and not a bar/restaurant. This on top of guys that felt the that they can walk across our table to get to their mates and staff that paid no attention to our complaints about it made the overall atmosphere and night quite disappointing.

aYZp74toFO79VDty0Ne6Bw.text: Popped in for a quick lunch. Had the chicken BLT sandwich which was a solid choice. Nothing mind blowing but good quality. I chose the Cowboy fries as a side which were excellent. They are honey garlic fries, actual French fries, that have a sort of honey BBQ flavor. One thing that stood out was the choice of fountain Diet Coke. Most places locally have bottles or cans but no fountain drinks. If that's a selling point for you, this is the place

Qh1MRigni2CXrLz6cK5Ezw.text: I went here on a work lunch and boy were my expectations exceeded.I'd ordered the pork and mash, and despite being a simple dish, it was executed delightfully. Great sausages, with absolutely no gristle.Then the Mac n Cheese. I forgot to snap a picture of the beauty, which is unlike me...Anyway it was the best Mac n Cheese I've ever had in London. It was served in a small cast iron pan. And there were garnishes of leak and bacon in there too. The cheese melted perfectly on top. And this was only a side but, actually the side of some mains in other restaurants!I may have had my issues with food at the Refinery in the past, but I think it's certainly something they are actually addressing as the chicken burger I had a few months earlier was also of decent quality!I wonder whether the fact I came with a big party the first time (20+ persons) why the food was under par...

SltG9S-0XZyXNeEFh2dYcg.text: Great little Italian restaurant! The staff are very friendly and the space in itself is very open and super clean. The food came out in less than 5 minutes and it was very tasty, although my granddaughter ate all my plate! I definately recommend the risotto.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom

FtZRIJ8Qea75vj7SzZzI0Q.text: This experience was rather mediocre. I escaped the rain with a friend for some brunch, but their brunch menu was not on. Ordered a club sandwich, which was not great as the bread was hardly toasted. We also ordered coffees that took entirely too long to arrive considering how few people were in the restaurant. The worst part was the fire alarm went off, which happens but it delayed everyone's food. They at least told us this, but for ordering a sandwich and a salmon salad our food still came late and was so unmemorable I doubt I will go again, especially as it overpriced. You are better off across the street at The Table!

ZdSLBoFHniYEWQ26-kQ1nw.text: Just had an early dinner at The Refinery. Haddock & Chips first rate. Roast Chicken Salad first rate. Summer Pudding first rate. Lemon Tart first rate. Service excellent and friendly. Decor an interesting mix of rustic and Eames. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom. Haddock & Chips

wOiZA0md54OkC1gZSdULNQ.text: I had always wanted to try this place and ended up going here last Sunday for my friend's bday. We had a nice long table (there were around 12 of us) and the restaurant was probably half full. On arrival we were handed menus with the specials and roasts on and half the group were massively excited to get the roast beef. On ordering, they were told that there was none left. This was a massive and disappointing oversight and we weren't at all impressed especially as no alternative was offered. When the server returned we suggested substituting for a steak dish and this was agreed though it was a little stressful and shouldn't have got to this! Personally I had the scampi and fish basket which was nice but not plentiful with nice chips and tartare sauce. We had a delicious bottle of Malbec. If I could've fitted it in I would've gone for the alcoholic tiramisu pudding as it sounded amazing! Now I've tried it not sure I'd return in a rush but it was nice enough with good food and drinks and at typical London prices. Handy Southwark location between London Bridge and Waterloo.

QfpIDm0gl9-r2Rbei6aOvg.text: Pleasant atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food and drinks! We felt very comfortable during the dinner and the music and decorative interior laid the foundation for a cozy evening.

x0JVShejttw9-r1oYXoDDA.text: Loved the vibe, awesome wait staff ( you get several servers it seems) we especially loved Jessica who seated us. I had a flatbread with duck. And for dessert... Chocolate brownie with ice cream.... Plate dusted with powdered sugar and three fresh raspberries and to top it iff hot fudge sauce in a little cup to pour in yourself. Come and open a branch in Juneau, AK!

photos.caption: Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom. AMAZING MACARONI N CHEESE  and cheese burger
Photo of The Refinery - London, United Kingdom. Duck on flatbread with hoison sauce

np97GVCCPIGjeJYDEpsDCw.text: Came here for a work lunch with 5 colleagues and had a good time. FOODGreat, simple, tasty. and fresh. Had the fish pie, side of tomato salad. Colleagues who had the burger said the patty was dry. Others who had the salmon and the chicken said it was really good. DRINKSI had the flat white and it was not good. Way, way to milky for a FW. Some others had the juice of the say and said it was good. SERVICEGreat service for lunchtime. Only saw 3 servers for the whole restaurant so they must do a good job although wasn't too busy. Food came out in a good time. ATMOSPHERENice interiors. Boho chic. Like the long picnic tables and the bar area. Would like to try it out for drinks. OVERALLGreat food for what you pay, good service, and hopefully good cocktails. I want to visit again - just won't be my work-break coffee joint.

rBhxbKVmvxMSbTlUK3jC0A.text: Only been in London 4 days and already we have been here twice (and I would love to go again and again). The menu is spectacular, the atmosphere is amazing, the service is impeccable and the food, well, the food is the best part. We had sausages and mash, seafood risotto (a special), the Sunday roast and fish and chips. Prices may be a bit high, but for what you get its well worth it. Can't go wrong!
